list_definition.definition: to mean or plan (to do something or that someone else should do something)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Do you still intend to go?
Do you intend them to go?
Do you intend that they should go too?

list_definition.definition: to mean (something) to be understood in a particular way

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His remarks were intended to be a compliment.
That letter/bullet was intended for me.

list_ex_of_english: I intend my remarks as suggestions for expanding the argument - and perhaps the research - beyond the promising start made here.
Although not intended by these authors, their views suggest that theories which are typically considered opposing and incompatible complement each other.
This view is supported by studies that are intended to show that satisfactory understanding on the part of patients cannot be achieved.
There is also a witnesses' room with separate access to the court - a last-minute addition to the plans, primarily intended for women.
The quotation marks surrounding "temporarily" are intended to convey that absolute systemic rigor is an illusory ideal.
But if the text was indeed intended as a reference book, other interesting possibilities arise.
The e-mail questionnaire was intended to provide the research team with baseline information and as a source for preparing individual-tailored semistructured interviews.
Religion remained a significant determinant of intended family size but its effect had diminished.
